column2: location=Between the rivers [[Esgalduin]] and [[Aros]]; [[Doriath]] and [[Ered Gorgoroth]]

column1: '''Dor Dínen''', the '''Silent Land''', was a small, roughly triangular region to the east of [[Nan Dungortheb]] that lay between the upper courses of the rivers [[Esgalduin]] and [[Aros]]. It was crossed by a road passing from the stone bridge of [[Iant Iaur]] on Esgalduin to the ford of the [[Arossiach]] on Aros. Its southern edge met the forests of [[Doriath]]. The Arossiach led to the northern marches of [[Himlad]] to the east.<ref>{{S
''Dor Dínen'' is [[Sindarin]] and comes from ''[[dor]]'' "land" and ''[[dínen]]'' "silent".{{fact}}
